page.title: 12 Clanville.
page.content:
The largest{house}in{Clanville}is cleverly enough called Clanville House! There are several of these larger{houses}in the block which still remain from the days of 'squire' and people. The is a{petrol station,} food shop and{Post Office.
The local priest when interviewed bore testimony to the people as '...very kind and helpful...with a close sense of community...it is a pleasure to live here...'
The older{houses}are of the same thatch with brick and flint construction which typifies the whole of the area. Newer housing tends to intrude on these traditional materials, used originally for cheapness and now impossibly expensive because of high labour costs.
